*[appveyor.yml, line 11 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlqygXebGpqT_8UByE4:-KlqygXfiOd1vujQl_PN:b-d469ap) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/appveyor.yml#L11)):*
> ```YAML
> - if not exist %APPDATA%\downloads mkdir %APPDATA%\downloads
> # libcheck
> - if not exist %APPDATA%\downloads\check.tar.gz curl -L https://github.com/libcheck/check/archive/0.11.0.zip -o %APPDATA%\downloads\check.zip
> ```

You check the existence of `check.tar.gz` but download `check.zip`

---

*[cmake/Dependencies.cmake, line 69 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlqwC3gapmpHeRm6Wu2:-KlqwC3hKk-tss8QBgT7:bcwojdo) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/cmake/Dependencies.cmake#L69)):*
> ```CMake
>   find_library(LIBCHECK_LIBRARIES
>     NAMES check libcheck
>     PATHS "C:/Program Files (x86)/check/lib"
> ```

I think `%ProgramFilesDir%/check/lib` will be better. Same for other "Prgram Files (x86)"

---

I think `%ProgramFilesDir%/check/lib` will be better. Same for other "Prgram Files (x86)"
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556)*

*[CMakeLists.txt, line 397 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlsBTTuemjjlEl1l1jY:-KlsBTTvXRHA_M8pa2B2:b-pa08nc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/CMakeLists.txt#L397)):*
> ```CMake
>       set_tests_properties(${target} PROPERTIES TIMEOUT "${TEST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS}")
>     endif()
>   endif()
> ```

Kind of weird how `DISABLED` test means "build=true, run=false", while `MSVC_DISABLED` means "build=false, run=false". One could think that `MSVC_DISABLED` does exactly what `DISABLED` does but only for MSVC and they would be wrong.

Perhaps changing `DISABLED` to `DONT_RUN` and `MSVC_DISABLED` to `MSVC_DONT_BUILD`, or to something along these lines, would be better? Alternatively, keeping `DISABLED` as it is but removing `MSVC_DISABLED` by pulling the `if ("${CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID}" STREQUAL "MSVC")` out of `auto_test()` would be fine too.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

*[cmake/Dependencies.cmake, line 69 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlqwC3gapmpHeRm6Wu2:-KlsENf4ACKUCX0-Zz-2:b-5uzj44) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/cmake/Dependencies.cmake#L69)):*
Previously, iphydf wrote…
Done.
I don't understand what was wrong with using the working directory for everything and doing things relative to its path. You don't install libraries in `Program Files` on Windows. When you develop on Windows, all libraries your program depends on are usually in some directory called "deps" or "3rd-party" next to your source tree. You also ship the libraries together with your software product, so that when you install, say, qTox, all the libraries qTox depends on are in `C:/Program Files (x86)/qTox`, next to `qTox.exe`, not in `C:/Program Files (x86)/tocore`, `C:/Program Files (x86)/opus`, `C:/Program Files (x86)/sodium`, etc. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556)*

Reviewed 28 of 28 files at r2.

Review status: 24 of 27 files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions. --- *[CMakeLists.txt, line 397 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlsBTTuemjjlEl1l1jY:-KlsH4b_JFWII22vG-La:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/CMakeLists.txt#L397)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Kind of weird how `DISABLED` test means "build=true, run=false", while `MSVC_DISABLED` means "build=false, run=false". One could think that `MSVC_DISABLED` does exactly what `DISABLED` does but only for MSVC and they would be wrong. Perhaps changing `DISABLED` to `DONT_RUN` and `MSVC_DISABLED` to `MSVC_DONT_BUILD`, or to something along these lines, would be better? Alternatively, keeping `DISABLED` as it is but removing `MSVC_DISABLED` by pulling the `if ("${CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID}" STREQUAL "MSVC")` out of `auto_test()` would be fine too.
Done. --- *[cmake/Dependencies.cmake, line 69 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-KlqwC3gapmpHeRm6Wu2:-KlsH5VTvwRfqGgIDeyp:b-4pcn7j) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/f7af299ea601587b70d00a353cb67366536f51cc/cmake/Dependencies.cmake#L69)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
I don't understand what was wrong with using the working directory for everything and doing things relative to its path. You don't install libraries in `Program Files` on Windows. When you develop on Windows, all libraries your program depends on are usually in some directory called "deps" or "3rd-party" next to your source tree. You also ship the libraries together with your software product, so that when you install, say, qTox, all the libraries qTox depends on are in `C:/Program Files (x86)/qTox`, next to `qTox.exe`, not in `C:/Program Files (x86)/tocore`, `C:/Program Files (x86)/opus`, `C:/Program Files (x86)/sodium`, etc.
Added an explanation for it. I like to override defaults as little as possible. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556)*

--- Reviewed 22 of 28 files at r2, 6 of 6 files at r3. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/556#-:-Klti-ebMP-9YOwS06Gy:b-jbsf8z)*

commit.message:
Build tests on appveyor, the MSVC build.

Tests are not actually ran on appveyor for now, since they all fault for
some reason. For now, we just build them. Also, some tests are disabled
on msvc entirely, because they don't even compile. We'll need to look
into those, later. They are disabled using `MSVC_DONT_BUILD`.

committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1496670320 +0000

Build tests on appveyor, the MSVC build.

Tests are not actually ran on appveyor for now, since they all fault for
some reason. For now, we just build them. Also, some tests are disabled
on msvc entirely, because they don't even compile. We'll need to look
into those, later. They are disabled using `MSVC_DONT_BUILD`.
